byline.contributor: Vinod Sreeharsha contributed reporting from Rio de Janeiro.

abstract: Brazil's Pres Dilma Rousseff rebuffs efforts to force her resignation as government endures corruption scandals and country's economy nosedives; asserts lawmakers' move to impeach her, which 68 percent of Brazilians support, is based on sexist double standard and her ouster would do long-term damage to country's democratic process.

headline.print_headline: Brazil’s President Resists Calls for Her Resignation
headline.main: Dilma Rousseff, President of Brazil, Resists Calls for Her Resignation

snippet: Despite the scandals engulfing her government, Ms. Rousseff said in an interview on Thursday that she would appeal any vote to impeach her.
lead_paragraph: Despite the scandals engulfing her government, Ms. Rousseff said in an interview on Thursday that she would appeal any vote to impeach her.
